oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Cost of producing milk
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Conlin, Joe
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: costs
Dairy farming
dairy farms
economics
Milk
Milk production
milk production costs
production costs
profitability
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper was presented at the Minnesota Dairy Conference for Veterinarians held at the College of Veterinary Medicine, University of Minnesota (Minnesota, USA, 5-6 June 1991). Costs associated with milk production are examined with reference to the dairy profit equation, profit = (price - cost) Ã— vol., and financial performance parameters and simulated budget summaries for dairy farms in Wisconsin, USA. Profit performance was found to be highly variable from farm to farm relative to all production measures; highly profitable farms had larger herd sizes, higher production per cow, lower feed costs, received a higher milk price and had better control of practically all production cost categories; and the benefit of tighter control of economic efficiencies improved profitability by >$2.50/cwt independent of productivity.
